title: Our Great North East Survey reveals a home owning crisis and a region struggling to make ends meet - Chronicle Live

The hopes, fears and every day lives of the people of the region have been laid bare in our Great North East Survey. 
We asked you to answer a series of questions on a range of subjects to gain a unique insight into your lives. 
Around 1,000 people from all age groups across the whole of Tyneside, Northumberland and County Durham took part. 
And today we publish the first of two reports based on our findings. 
In some of the most eye catching results in today’s report, we can reveal: The North East still backs Labour over the Tories. Just. The majority of people who took part think they are less well off than their parents. There’s a clear Brexit split between those who think it will be a good thing for the region and those who think it will be bad. There is a large number of people in the region who classify themselves in Theresa May’s ‘Just About Managing’ category. People think job opportunities are much worse than a decade ago and a worrying number fear they will never own their own home GENERAL ELECTION A voter placing a ballot paper in the ballot box (Photo: Rui Vieira/PA Wire) 
We asked how you voted at the 2015 general election and Labour came out on top with 39.8%. The Tories came second on 21.3%, UKIP third on 10.3% and the Lib Dems on 7.7%. 
However voting intentions for 2017 see the figures shift markedly. 
While the Conservative vote held up at 22%, for Labour the figure dropped to 27.6% - a large 12.2% fall. 
However, we began collating our results just before the start of the election campaign when Labour nationally was around 20% down in the opinion polls. 
Their numbers have improved enormously since then and it’s worth considering the very large 25.73% in our survey who had yet to make up their minds in our survey. 
Meanwhile, 62% of respondents either were not happy or think the present government is a disaster. 
And 80% were not happy then with the way Labour was performing in opposition. 
Of the rest, the most notable is the 5.6% figure for UKIP which represents almost a halving of its support, the latest number reflecting where it stands today nationally. BREXIT An EU flag flying in front of the Houses of Parliament (Photo: PA) 
Brexit is not just one of the key issues of the general election, the thought hangs like an ominous cloud over the North East for a huge swathe of respondents to our survey. 
There was an equal split over whether they think it will be good or not for region - 34% good or very good and 36% bad or disastrous. 
Of the people who took part, 45% voted remain and 43% Leave. Today 84% said they vote the same way. Read More FINANCES For Sale signs (Photo: PA) 
Many believe they are less well off than their parents - 41.2% worse off to 40.8% better off. 
One of the biggest gaps in our survey was between those think job opportunities are much worse than 10 years ago - 49%, compared to 12% better. 
Meanwhile, of those who completed our survey and didn’t own a home, 60% thought they would never be able to afford one. 
That is backed up by the figure for the region of people who see themselves as Just About Managing - 48% - while 8% said they were really struggling. 
Our report into the state of the North East continues tomorrow when we reveal your views on regional identity, public services and frankly admit to how much you drink and how healthy you think you are. Like us on Facebook
